input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is SCOMActor

This wrapper is used to find alerts that match a particular id.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <operation-name>get-alert-by-id</operation-name> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <alert-search-criteria> <criteria-expression> <key>Id</key> <value>4be8166b-2444-454e-9f81-534b7508f585</value> <operator>equals</operator> </criteria-expression> </alert-search-criteria> </command-parameters> </item> </items>
Parmeters Description:
operation-name[Required] Operation that will be executed
timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs
command-parameters[Required] This is the parent tag that contains actual parameters required to execute this particular operation.
alert-search-criteria[Required] This is the parent tag for defining the search criteria.
criteria-expression[Required] This is the parent tag which contains details that make up a single search criteria. Multiple 'criteria-expression' tags can be provided under 'alert-search-criteria'.
key[Required] This tag contains the alert attribute by which the alerts are filtered. The allowed value for this wrapper is: Id
value[Required] This tag contains the valid search expression for the attribute specified in the key. Please refer to Criteria guide for valid search criteria expression format. NOTE: For help on writing regular expressions refer to 'Regular Expressions Guide.doc'
operator[Required] The 'operator' tag specified under 'alert-search-criteria' tag specifies the operand between multiple 'criteria-expression' tags. Valid values - and, or
The 'operator' tag specified under 'criteria-expression specifies the operand for key and value specified. Valid values - equals, not equals, like, in, greater than,less than
